content.description: Easy start. Move straight up through bolts and incipient flake system. Crux is pulling high past a flake and onto the face.
content.location: Route is one route over from the large chimney crack.

content.description: Right of a flamingo shaped bird head (you really gotta look to see it correctly). There is a wide chimney/crack to the right. Use this to stem off and up the wall in front of you. The route gets steep after pitch 1. p1:5.8, p2:5.10d Steep,but with really good bail out holds, p3:5.10d steep crimps.
content.location: just to the right of the 'bird head' flake about 20 feet.

content.description: Follow simple crimps on chert up through some balance moves. Continuous crimps are pumpy, but fun. Lots of petrified animals in this area
content.location: On the more southern/left side of the huge wall you will come to a place where the cliff makes you go downhill. There is a large chimney in facing you on approach. This climb in about 90ft before that and up a bulging face/slab.

content.description:
P1:5.9, P2:5.11a, P3:5.8, P4:5.9, P5:11c, P6:5.11a

All of Blackleaf is limestone. This route highlights some of the chert layers. Route start about 90 feet left of the 'Fox' cave. Boulder up chert edges past a low bulge to start the route. From there follow the bolts.
content.location: left of 'Fox'. Middle of the wall roughly

content.description: Climb the face right of the gaping chimney. Careful on the start a fall there could be nasty. Follow the fossil embedded chert to anchors shared with Top Gun.
content.location: Just to the right of the chimney and to the left of Top Gun.

content.description: The route is steep, but the holds are large. The crux is 2-3 bolts up the route. Big moves make you  feel like a hero. People say soft for the grade, but maybe it is just fun.
content.location: In the middle of the face there is a cave with steep ledges going up and out. Mojo tower is just to the left of this cave.

climbs.name: Climbign 101
climbs.fa: Rob Hagler and Mike Tompson, September 2002

content.description:
P1: (5.4)Start on a flat sand bar by the creek bed. 90' to a large ledge with chains.

P:2(5.4) Follow the line of least resistance past 3 or 4 bolts to a chains on a ledge. 90'

P3: (5.7) follow up past a chossy ledge to the steeping wall to good holds. It started to get fun from here.

P4:(5.8)in 2004 Dan Clark joined the FAs to add the upper two pitches, there a bit chosey but are getting better.

P5: (5.9) just a bit harder than the 5.8 and still in the choss.
content.protection:
Protection: quick draws and personal anchor of you choice.

All fixed anchors
content.location: Follow the creek right along the cliff, when you get to the end look up to see the bolts.

content.description:
P1:(5.9) Start just left of "home boys on Soy" and follow the bolts 90' to chains.

P2: (5.10)Follow the bolts up the prominent prow, 90'

P3:(5.10) Head up left trending face to a ledge.

P4:(5.10+) think shy of 5.11, its getting stout now. Follow the face that's just wonderful and crimpy with thin but fun feet to chains just below a roof.

P:5 (5.12+) didn't try this pitch.  It heads up a very slick looking shield.
content.protection:
Pro: Quick draws

Anchors:  all fixed chains if I remember right.
content.location:
Located between "Homeboys on Soy" and "Yuan Chi"

Look for the "Birds head" that marks "homeboys"

bolts start like 25 feet up, so look up.

getting down: double length 60s will do it.
